title: Legendary Patriots kicker Adam Vinatieri elected to Pro Football Hall of Fame
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Adam Vinatieri elected to the Pro Football Hall of Fame during the NFL Honors ceremony in San Francisco.
Vinatieri is the NFLâ€™s all-time scoring leader with 2,673 points and holds the record for made field-goals (599).
He played 24 seasons, winning four Super Bowls and is only the third kicker inducted into the Hall of Fame.

title: Drake Maye loses MVP race to Matthew Stafford by razor-thin margin
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots QB Drake Maye finished second in NFL MVP voting, just one first-place vote behind Rams QB Matthew Stafford.
Drake Maye led the NFL in completion percentage (72%) and QBR (77.1) while leading the Patriots to a 14-3 record.
Matthew Stafford won the MVP with 24 first-place votes, surpassing Maye's 23 votes, marking the closest race since 2003.

title: Mike Vrabel named 2025 NFL Coach of the Year
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel named NFL Coach of the Year 2025 after leading New England Patriots to Super Bowl LX.
Vrabel previously won NFL Coach of the Year with Tennessee Titans in 2021; joins select group of multi-time winners.
Patriots finished 2025 season 17-3 under Vrabel, transforming from previous back-to-back four-win seasons.

title: Unlike Tom Brady, Tedy Bruschi has a dog in the Patriots-Seahawks fight
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Tedy Bruschi supports the Patriots in Super Bowl LX, unlike Tom Brady who remains neutral.
Bruschi cites friendship with coach Mike Vrabel as a reason for backing the Patriots strongly.
Bruschi sees similarities between the current Patriots team and the 2001 championship team.

title: Pedestrian struck by police cruiser at UMass Lowell, officials say
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A pedestrian was struck by a police cruiser at UMass Lowell's South Campus Thursday evening.
The incident occurred near the intersection of Broadway and Wilder Street around 6:30 p.m., according to police.
Lowell police and Massachusetts State Police are investigating; counseling resources are available for witnesses.

title: New Bedford police investigate after man goes missing, drowns in harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jason Vasquez, 51, was discovered drowned in New Bedford Harbor three days after being reported missing.
Vasquez was last seen visiting a local adult establishment and was reported missing on January 30 by his boss.
New Bedford and Massachusetts State Police are investigating the drowning without ruling out the possibility of foul play.

title: Cambridge brewery workers plan to unionize, file for election
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Lamplighter Brewing Co. employees in Cambridge have filed for a union election with UFCW Local 1445.
The workers at two taprooms aim to join the union representing 11,000 Massachusetts members in retail and food processing.
Bartenders Owen Murray and Ryan McFarland support unionizing to ensure their perspectives are considered in industry changes.

title: Patriots OC Josh McDaniels named AP Assistant Coach of the Year
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Josh McDaniels named AP Assistant Coach of the Year for transforming Patriots' offense into second-highest scoring in NFL.
Patriots improved from 17 to 28.8 points per game, ranking third in total yards per game under McDaniels.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel praises McDaniels' impact, while QB Drake Maye credits him for offensive success.

title: Patriots, Seahawks both have defensive starters missing from practice
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots linebacker Harold Landry III did not practice due to a knee injury and has struggled with performance post-injury.
Patriots linebacker Robert Spillane practiced in a limited capacity with an ankle injury ahead of Super Bowl LX.
Seahawks rookie safety Nick Emmanwori missed practice after an ankle injury but is expected to play after further evaluation.

title: NY man allegedly stole $325K in seafood from Worcester warehouse in 1 of several heists
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Romoy Forbes, a Jamaican citizen in NY, charged with stealing $325K in seafood from a Worcester warehouse.
Forbes allegedly hacked trucking emails to book cargo, committing thefts involving snow crabs, blueberries, and cologne.
Forbes faces up to 10 years for interstate transportation of stolen goods and 5 years for conspiracy.
